F0.explanation: This is met when any of the F0 algorithms is met.

F00.0.1.explanation: Criteria for F00 met with age of onset < 65 years

F00.0.2.explanation: (a) rapid onset or (b) presence of apha-sia or agraphia or alexia or acalculia or apraxia

F00.0.2B.explanation: (b) presence of apha-sia or agraphia or alexia or acalculia or apraxia

F00.1.1.explanation: Criteria for F00 met with onset>65 years of age

F00.1.2.explanation: (a) slow gradual onset and pro-gression or (b) predominance of memory impairment

F00B.explanation: no evidence of other possible causes

F00G3.explanation: decline in emotional control, motivation or social behaviourwith >=1 of (1)-(4) (1) emotional lability (2) irritability (3) apathy (4) coarsening of social behaviour

F01G1.explanation: General criteria for dementia (G1 - G4) met

F01G3.explanation: Clinical evidence of focal brain damage

F02.0A.explanation: General criteria for dementia (G1 - G4) met

F02.0D.explanation: In early stages memory and parietal lobe functions relatively preserved

F02.3A.explanation: General criteria for dementia (G1 - G4) met

F02.3C.explanation: Cognitive impairment not due to antiparkinson medication

F02.3D.explanation: Not caused by other organic etiology

F02.4A.explanation: General criteria for dementia (G1 - G4) met

F04.explanation: Organic amnesic syndrome, not induced by alcohol or psychoactive substances

F04A.explanation: Memory impairment (1) defect in recent memory and (2) reduced ability to recall past experiences

F04B.explanation: (1) no defect in immediate recall and (2) no delirium and (3) no global intellectual decline

F04C.explanation: Evidence of brain organic etiology No evidence of alcohol or sub-stance use etiology

F05.explanation: Delirium, not induced by alcohol and other psychoactive substances

F05B.explanation: (1) impairment of immediate recall and recent memory with intact remote memory and (2) disorientation

F05E.explanation: Rapid onset and fluctuations over the course of the day

F05F.explanation: Evidence of brain organic etiology no evidence of alcohol or substance use etiology

F06.1D.explanation: Rapid alternation of stupor and exitement

F06.3B.explanation: Criteria met for F30.- or F31.- or F32.- or F38.00

F06.4A.explanation: General criteria for F06 met and

F06.4B.explanation: Meet criteria for F44.0. or F41.1 except for organic attribution

F06EX.explanation: no alcohol or psychoactive substance use etiology

F06F32B2.explanation: CHANGE IN THE CALCULATION OF f32_0b

F06F32C6.explanation: CHANGE IN THE CALCULATION OF f32_0C

F07.explanation: Personality and behavioural disorders due to brain disease, damage or dysfunction

F07.0B1.explanation: reduced ability to persevere with goal-directed activities

F07.0B2.explanation: (2) >=1 of (a)-(d) (a) emotional lability (b) euphoria, jocularity (c) irritability (d) apathy

F07.0B4.explanation: cognitive disturbance (a) suspiciousness or paranoid ideas (b) preoccupation with single themes

F07.0B5.explanation: (5) language alterations circumstantiality overinclusiveness viscosity hypergraphia

F07.0B6.explanation: (6) altered sexual behaviour hyposexuality change in preference

F07G1.explanation: Objective evidence of brain organic etiology and no alcohol or substance use etio-logy

F07G2.explanation: No clouding of consciousness no memory deficit

F20.0C.explanation: Does not meet criteria for F20_1 B or C or F20_2 B

F21A4.explanation: (4) odd beliefs or magical think-ing influencing behaviour

F21B.explanation: F20 G1 + G2 never met and F20_6 not fulfilled
